    East Africa Tech Momentum

    Low-code training and digital skills for youth across Kenya, Uganda, and Tanzania.

    Zoho expands digital skills program across East Africa

    By Zawadi Intel News Staff ‚Ä¢ Dec 1, 2025

    Zoho has expanded its digital skills initiative across Kenya, Uganda, and Tanzania, training youth in low-code app development and practical software tools. The program aims to bridge the digital skills gap by offering hands-on learning that accelerates employability and entrepreneurship.

    Participants learn to build applications without extensive coding knowledge, focusing on problem-solving, user experience, and rapid prototyping. The approach empowers young Africans to create solutions tailored to local needs‚Äîfrom small business workflows to community services.

    Partnerships with universities, vocational centers, and community hubs ensure accessibility and relevance. Graduates gain foundational skills in modern software ecosystems, positioning them to contribute to digital transformation across sectors like finance, health, logistics, and education.

    Zoho‚Äôs expansion reflects growing investment in African tech talent. By lowering barriers to entry, the program supports job creation, startup formation, and a more inclusive digital economy‚Äîespecially for youth and underserved communities.

    As more participants join, the initiative could catalyze a new wave of tech startups in East Africa, strengthening local innovation networks and building capacity for scalable, sustainable solutions.

    üåç What is Zoho‚Äôs mission?

    Zoho builds accessible, privacy-conscious software for businesses and communities. Its education programs focus on practical, low-code tools that help learners ship real solutions quickly‚Äîwithout needing advanced programming backgrounds.
